metadata.Title: CVE-2018-7167 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
Calling Buffer.fill() or Buffer.alloc() with some parameters can lead to ahang which could result in a Denial of Service. In order to address thisvulnerability, the implementations of Buffer.alloc() and Buffer.fill() wereupdated so that they zero fill instead of hanging in these cases. Allversions of Node.js 6.x (LTS "Boron"), 8.x (LTS "Carbon"), and 9.x arevulnerable. All versions of Node.js 10.x (Current) are NOT vulnerable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-7167` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnode72 - 10.15.1~dfsg-5
nodejs - 10.15.1~dfsg-5
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: nodejs package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.15.1~dfsg-5').
